intro: Melicope clusiifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its bark is smooth and reddish-brown, while its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds. Melicope clusiifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
